title: Can we Hope more Dodge spells in the future?
body: Meddler please answer to this, Dodge as a stats might be overbearing because it's permanent, but what about dodge in spells like jax's counter strike or shen's W? needing a window of time to use its power.

replies.body: I expect we'll do other dodge abilities with limited uptime at some point in the future. It'll be a tool we offer sparingly though, not a common thing on kits.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BWMAzRrE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-14T03:46:21.461+0000)
>
> I expect we'll do other dodge abilities with limited uptime at some point in the future. It'll be a tool we offer sparingly though, not a common thing on kits.

O_O *metal gear-esque "!" appears when that was the exact verbiage used to describe knock ups*
and no dodge chance (just 100%) i assume?

I'd expect so.

Edit for clarity: I'd expect any future uses of dodge to be effects that granted 100% dodge.

Why? Is dodge something that's actually been seen as something fun to play against? I was under the assumption that the reason we haven't seen much of it was because it isn't very healthy for the game. A lot of people find that to be one of the most annoying aspects of Jax / Fiora, both of which being overwhelmingly banned at the moment.

don't talk about what you don't know, jax used to have 100% dodge permanently because dodge used to stack, riot easily fixed it by make it unique, then they gave true strike to the fontain. 

the problem with jax in 2011 is that true strike was WEAK as fuck, sword of the divine was purchased on nobody. the other problem was RNG, until jax had his E at lvl 5 his dodge chance was low making his E relying on RNG, they should have fixed it by giving him passivly 100% dodge for 1 attack with a cooldown
It USED to be back when dodge was a stat. It basically meant Jax could 1v5 in the enemy fountain.

Except it does, and they've had to change how his dodge works multiple times because of how strong it is within his kit. It's just not the only thing that makes him strong at the moment, and the pre-season patch allowed Jax to become very overbearing in the right hands. 

In fact, Riot has spent a lot of time removing dodge effects from the game: 
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Dodge

Which is partially why I think it's kind of counter intuitive we're seeing so many new iterations of it which are just as frustrating.

If more dodging abilities are potentially forthcoming, I feel extra motivated to clarify at this point in time - another Rioter [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/OAZqJ4d1-champion-update-shen?comment=0085000000000000) says only large monster attacks are dodged for consistency with Pantheon's block.  But since it's a duration-based ability, wouldn't it make more sense to be consistent with Jax's counterstrike instead and negate all incoming basic attacks?

Wow that's really weird and silly having it not block small monsters...
and yeah it is clearly closer to Jax E not Pantheon passive

Jax E and Shen W both block all attacks for a limited time
Pantheon blocks 1 attack (every time he builds up his passive)

I asked in the shen thread, but they were unable to answer. Maybe you could.

There isn't much clarity or consistency in what is dodged, blocked, or blinded.

I made a thread here describing the inconsistencies: 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/i0h2qxq4-riot-wondering-if-you-could-provide-some-clarity-about-on-hit-applying-abilities 

How exactly are these supposed to interact, can you bring more consistency to the effects (like braum and yas vs projectiles), and can you tell us which abilities shen's dodge will be able to negate?  

That ability could shut down certain champs like Fiora hard, but if it's like Jax's dodge, Yas will ignore it which may cause confusion.

To be fair the original mechanic was % chance to dodge vs the current mechanic which is essentially temporary invincibility to basic attacks. The current mechanic is not random and therefore still fits their goals of balance and transparency.
